isis.stitle: DT 466 / DT 570 / HT 570 Service Manual - 2004 Emissions with EGR - Engine Electrical - Installation - ECM, IDM, EGR Drive Module, and Intake Air Heater

svcproc.title: ECM, IDM, EGR Drive Module, and Intake Air Heater

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, disconnect the main negative battery terminal before removing or installing any electrical components.

caution.para: To avoid engine damage, make sure the key is in the OFF position before unplugging the connector or relay for the ECM, IDM, and EGR drive module. Failure to turn the key to the OFF position will cause a voltage spike and damage the electrical components.

To avoid engine damage, do not tug on any wiring harnesses while trying to remove them. If resistance is felt, find the source of resistance and free up any connectors or clips that are caught before proceeding.

note.para: The ECM, IDM, and EGR drive modules can be assembled as a single unit on a workbench or they can be installed individually on the crankcase. It will be assembled here on a workbench for illustrative purposes.

calloutgroup.callout1: Hex socket head screws, M8 x 40 (4)

figure.caption: Installing the IDM onto the ECM

step1.para: Lay the IDM over the ECM as shown.
Lay the IDM / ECM bracket assembly over the IDM.

Install four hex socket head screws (M8 x 40), lockwashers and nuts (M8) to secure the IDM / ECM bracket assembly to the IDM and hand tighten. These screws will be torqued later when mounting assembly onto crankcase.
Install the EGR drive module with two bolts (M6 x 16) and hand tighten. Bolts will be torqued later when mounting to crankcase.

figure.caption: ECM, IDM and EGR drive modules assembled
Installing the ECM, IDM, and EGR drive module assembly to crankcase

step1.para: Install ECM, IDM, and EGR drive module assembly to the crankcase with two mounting stud bolts (M8 x 45/19) on right side.
Install two bolts (M8 x 45) on left side to secure ECM, IDM, and EGR drive module assembly to crankcase.
Torque module assembly mounting bolts (M8 x 45) and stud bolts (M8 x 45/19) to the special torque value .
Torque both EGR drive module bolts (M6 x 16) to the standard torque value.

note.para: If your engine has the intake air heater feature, then continue with the following steps.

para.title: Intake Air Heater Wiring Harness Assembly

calloutgroup.callout1: Heater relay bracket bolt, M6 x 20 and nut, M6

step1.para: If applicable, install the intake air heater and bracket assembly over the two ECM / IDM assembly mounting stud bolts (M8 x 45/19).
Place injector shield ground wire onto top stud. Install a nut (M8) onto each stud and torque to the standard torque value.

figure.caption: Intake air heater and relay wiring harness

calloutgroup.callout1: Intake air heater mounting nuts, M6 (2)
Heater relay bracket bolt, M6 x 20 and nut, M6

step1.para: Position intake heater harness assembly into place.
Install intake air heater cable at starter solenoid.
Install intake air heater connections at the heater with two nuts (M6). Slide boots over the connections.

para.title: Injector harness at ECM, IDM, and EGR drive module

step1.para: Connect two ECM engine connectors.
Connect two IDM connectors.
Connect the injector shield ground connection.
Connect six injector connectors to the valve cover gasket.

para.title: Sensor harness at ECM, IDM, and EGR drive module

step1.para: Connect two ECM engine connectors.
Connect the CKP sensor.
Connect two intake air heater relay connectors.
Connect two ECM chassis connectors.
Connect the IDM connector.
Connect the EGR drive module.
Connect the ICP connector to the valve cover gasket.

figure.caption: ECM, IDM, EGR drive module, and tube assembly overview

step1.para: Install injector wiring harness underneath the EGR mixer duct and place harness snaps into anchor locations along the top side of the intake manifold.
Install all wiring harness snaps securing the sensor and injector wiring harnesses to the engine.
